I have tried to submit a game (just a test to see how a game made with the windows vet converts to web play) and i get an unknown error after upload. I have published it and did not include walkthrough as I have no made one. The game has a few images, and a mp3 sound file. What could be the reason for the error?

I'm using 5.1.1

Error:
Server Error in '/' Application.
Runtime Error

Posts.EditableText: After further testing with blank/new projects, i think i found the problem. Is there a maximum upload file size allowed? The file i original wished to upload was over 6mb's but one at 17k, and 1.9mb both uploaded fine.
Posts.HTML: After further testing with blank/new projects, i think i found the problem. Is there a maximum upload file size allowed? The file i original wished to upload was over 6mb's but one at 17k, and 1.9mb both uploaded fine.

Posts.EditableText: I hope my first game will be under the limit, considering I'm writing original music for it. Is there a way to get it approved or something to prove that it's not just filled with junk?
Posts.HTML: I hope my first game will be under the limit, considering I'm writing original music for it. Is there a way to get it approved or something to prove that it's not just filled with junk?

Posts.EditableText: Alex will have to confirm this as he's the one that set everything up, but I've never heard of a file limit. Possible that's because nobody's uploaded a game larger than a certain size before? If there is a limit set, I'm sure it would be a relatively simple matter to have Alex adjust it.
